014package org.jdbi.v3.sqlobject.locator;
015
016import java.lang.annotation.Retention;
017import java.lang.annotation.Target;
018
019import org.jdbi.v3.core.locator.ClasspathSqlLocator;
020import org.jdbi.v3.sqlobject.config.ConfiguringAnnotation;
021import org.jdbi.v3.sqlobject.locator.internal.UseClasspathSqlLocatorImpl;
022
023import static java.lang.annotation.ElementType.METHOD;
024import static java.lang.annotation.ElementType.TYPE;
025import static java.lang.annotation.RetentionPolicy.RUNTIME;
026
027/**
028 * Configures SQL Object to locate SQL using the {@link ClasspathSqlLocator#findSqlOnClasspath(Class, String)} method.
029 * If the SQL annotation (e.g. <code>@SqlQuery</code>) defines a value (e.g. <code>@SqlQuery("hello")</code>), that
030 * value (<code>"hello"</code>) will be used for the <code>name</code> parameter; if undefined, the name of the SQL
031 * object method will be used:
032 *
033 * <pre>
034 *     &#064;UseClasspathSqlLocator
035 *     interface Viccini {
036 *         &#064;SqlUpdate
037 *         void doTheThing(long id);     // =&gt; ClasspathSqlLocator.findSqlOnClasspath(Viccini.class, "doTheThing")
038 *
039 *         &#064;SqlUpdate("thatOtherThing")
040 *         void doTheThing(String name); // =&gt; ClasspathSqlLocator.findSqlOnClasspath(Viccini.class, "thatOtherThing")
041 *     }
042 * </pre>
043 */
044@ConfiguringAnnotation(UseClasspathSqlLocatorImpl.class)
045@Target({TYPE, METHOD})
046@Retention(RUNTIME)
047public @interface UseClasspathSqlLocator {
048    boolean stripComments() default true;
049}
